Note: There is no time limit for the exam. However, if you start the exam and log off before the exam is completed, that will be counted as one failed attempt.

QuestionGroup.Name: First
QuestionGroup.Intro:
Final Exam
You have been granted up to #MaxAtempt attempt(s) to pass this exam. You have #AtemptsLeft attempt(s) remaining. The exam will consist of #TotalQuestionCount questions. Click the Continue button below to proceed.

Note: There is no time limit for the exam. However, if you start the exam and log off before the exam is completed, that will be counted as one failed attempt.

Question.QuestionText: Which of the following activities does our acceptable use policy allow?

Answers.Answer:
A)

Transmission or retransmission of inappropriate content.

B)

Making illegal/pirated copies of software.

C)

Conducting personal business or solicitation at work.

D)

Communicating with colleagues concerning work related issues.

Rules.Rule:
Please Try Again

Please select your answer.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

The acceptable use policy disallows the transmission or retransmission of inappropriate content. It would not disallow communicating with colleagues concerning work related issues. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

The acceptable use policy disallows making illegal/pirated copies of software. It would not disallow communicating with colleagues concerning work related issues. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

The acceptable use policy disallows conducting personal business or solicitation at work. It would not disallow communicating with colleagues concerning work related issues. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Correct

The acceptable use policy allows communicating with colleagues concerning work related issues.

Click the Continue button below to proceed.

Question.QuestionText: How can you create a strong password that will slow down or even defeat a password cracker program?

Answers.Answer:
A)

Use a mix of numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters, and special characters in your password.

B)

Use as many characters as possible in your password.

C)

Use a long word found in a dictionary.

D)

Both A and B are correct.

Rules.Rule:
Please Try Again

Please select your answer.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

This is true, but using as many characters as possible in a password is also a good way to foil a password cracker program. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

This is true, but using a mix of numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters and special characters in your password is also a good way to foil a password cracker program. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

You should never use a word found in the dictionary. The correct answer is D.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Correct

You should use as many characters as possible in your password and use a mix of numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters, and special characters.

Click the Continue button below to proceed.

Question.QuestionText: If you think you are the victim of social engineering, you should do all of the following EXCEPT:

Answers.Answer:
A)

Get the person’s name and contact information.

B)

Wait one week, then contact your supervisor or the Help Desk.

C)

If it is happening over the phone, try to get the phone number using caller ID.

D)

Take detailed notes about what person is requesting.

Rules.Rule:
Please Try Again

Please select your answer.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

This is a best practice. The correct answer is B.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Correct

You should contact your supervisor or the Help Desk immediately.

Click the Continue button below to proceed.

Incorrect

This is a best practice. The correct answer is B.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

This is a best practice. The correct answer is B.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Question.QuestionText: True or False? Because you don’t have administrative rights to our network, you’re not a target for hackers.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Rules.Rule:
Please Try Again

Please select your answer.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Incorrect

If an attacker could gain control of any computer that resides on our network, he or she could use that as a jumping off point to attack other systems. Everyone is a potential target for hackers.

Click the red Close button to proceed.

Correct

If an attacker could gain control of any computer that resides on our network, he or she could use that as a jumping off point to attack other systems. Everyone is a potential target for hackers.

Click the Continue button below to proceed.
